intro: Parasystasia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali parasystasia, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a source of medicinal compounds in traditional practices.
